description: Dwarf chapparal-broom (Baccharis pilularis 'Pigeon Point') is a native shrub of southeastern California and Arizona, favored for its drought tolerant evergreen foliage and attractive white-fuzzy flowers. It's a true standout among California shrubs with its low spreading form and bright green bluish-gray foliage. Highly versatile, it tolerates sun or partial shade, sandy soils and coastal conditions. It's an ideal choice for low-water gardens; during periods of drought the foliage may become dry but quickly rebounds with the arrival of the rainy season. As an added bonus, deer, rabbits and gophers tend to avoid it. With its unique appearance and low maintenance, Dwarf Chapparal-broom is a fantastic addition to any landscape.
